It operates through Health Care Benefits, Health Services, and Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segments. The Health Care Benefits segment offers traditional, voluntary, and consumer-directed health insurance products and related services, including medical, pharmacy, dental and behavioral health plans, medical management capabilities, Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans, PDPs and Medicaid health care management services. It serves employer groups, individuals, college students, part-time and hourly workers, health plans, health care providers, governmental units, government-sponsored plans, labor groups, and expatriates. The Health Services segment offers pharmacy benefit management solutions, including plan design and administration, formulary management, retail pharmacy network management, specialty and mail order pharmacy, clinical, disease management, medical spend management services, and other administrative services. It serves employers, insurance companies, unions, government employee groups, health plans, prescription drug plans, Medicaid managed care plans, CMS, plans offered on public health insurance, and other sponsors of health benefit plans. The Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segment sells prescription and over-the-counter drugs, consumer health and beauty products, and personal care products. This segment also distributes prescription drugs; and provides related pharmacy consulting and other ancillary services to care facilities and other care settings. It operates online retail pharmacy websites, LTC pharmacies and on-site pharmacies, retail specialty pharmacy stores, compounding pharmacies and branches for infusion and enteral nutrition services. The company was formerly known as CVS Caremark Corporation and changed its name to CVS Health Corporation in September 2014. CVS Health Corporation was incorporated in 1996 and is headquartered in Woonsocket, Rhode Island.","tickerSymbol":"NYSE CVS"}}AllAllAnalysisAnalysisCommentsCommentsNewsNewsTranscripts & InsightsTranscripts & InsightsSEC FilingsSEC FilingsPress ReleasesPress ReleasesRelated AnalysisRelated Analysis7 Investing Groups Covering CVS »ChartsAdv Chart1D5D1M6MYTD1Y5Y10YMAXCVS Health Corporation price and volumeCombination chart with 2 data series.Chart represents CVS Health Corporation

It operates through Health Care Benefits, Health Services, and Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segments. The Health Care Benefits segment offers traditional, voluntary, and consumer-directed health insurance products and related services, including medical, pharmacy, dental and behavioral health plans, medical management capabilities, Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans, PDPs and Medicaid health care management services. It serves employer groups, individuals, college students, part-time and hourly workers, health plans, health care providers, governmental units, government-sponsored plans, labor groups, and expatriates. The Health Services segment offers pharmacy benefit management solutions, including plan design and administration, formulary management, retail pharmacy network management, specialty and mail order pharmacy, clinical, disease management, medical spend management services, and other administrative services. It serves employers, insurance companies, unions, government employee groups, health plans, prescription drug plans, Medicaid managed care plans, CMS, plans offered on public health insurance, and other sponsors of health benefit plans. The Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segment sells prescription and over-the-counter drugs, consumer health and beauty products, and personal care products. This segment also distributes prescription drugs; and provides related pharmacy consulting and other ancillary services to care facilities and other care settings. It operates online retail pharmacy websites, LTC pharmacies and on-site pharmacies, retail specialty pharmacy stores, compounding pharmacies and branches for infusion and enteral nutrition services. The company was formerly known as CVS Caremark Corporation and changed its name to CVS Health Corporation in September 2014. CVS Health CorporationHoldQuant RatingMarket Cap$95.62BEPS Growth (FWD)-6.45%P/E (FWD)11.84IndustryHealth Care ServicesDividend Yield (FWD)3.53%Dividend FrequencyQuarterlyEx-Dividend Date (Last)10/23/2025Annual Payout (FWD)$2.66Copy URLSharePrintCompany Description
CVS Health Corporation, based in Woonsocket, Rhode Island, is a prominent health solutions company in the United States, offering a wide range of services through its Health Care Benefits, Health Services, and Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segments. Founded in 1996, the company has evolved from its origins as CVS Caremark Corporation to become a diversified healthcare leader.

The Health Care Benefits segment provides insurance products and related services, including medical, pharmacy, dental, and behavioral health plans, as well as Medicare Advantage and Medicaid management services. This segment caters to various customers, including employer groups, individuals, and government-sponsored plans.

The Health Services segment manages pharmacy benefits, offering solutions such as plan design, formulary management, and specialty pharmacy services. It also operates medical clinics and provides virtual and in-home care.

The Pharmacy & Consumer Wellness segment focuses on retail pharmacy services, selling both prescription and over-the-counter medications, health products, and personal care items. CVS operates over 9,000 retail locations, providing extensive accessibility to its services.

Through strategic acquisitions, such as Aetna in 2018 and Oak Street Health in 2023, CVS has expanded its footprint in health insurance and value-based care. The company is committed to integrating healthcare delivery and improving health outcomes through technology-driven solutions and a national network of community health destinations.
Competitors and Unique Value
CVS Health faces competition from several major players in the healthcare and retail pharmacy sectors. Among its primary competitors are:
UnitedHealth GroupCigna CorporationWalgreens Boots Alliance
CVS Health's unique value proposition lies in its integrated healthcare model, which combines insurance, pharmacy services, and retail health into a cohesive ecosystem. The company's vast network of retail locations and clinics offers convenient access to health services nationwide. Additionally, CVS's strategic investments in value-based care through acquisitions like Oak Street Health demonstrate its commitment to improving patient outcomes while managing costs effectively.
Seeking Alpha Quant Rating Explanation
CVS is rated Hold. The company demonstrates a strong profitability profile and significant stock momentum. However, its growth metrics show challenges, while its valuation appears attractive. Analyst revisions are predominantly positive, suggesting some optimism about future performance.
ValuationA-GrowthD-ProfitabilityA+MomentumB+RevisionsB+Sector Metrics Comparative Analysis:Valuation: CVS trades at an appealing valuation with a P/E of 12, significantly lower than the sector median of 18, indicating a discounted stock. Additionally, the forward PEG of 0.62 is a 65% discount to the sector, suggesting underpricing. However, its Price to Book ratio of 1.27 is much lower than the sector median of 2.83, further highlighting its relative undervaluation.
Growth: The company faces growth challenges, with Year-over-Year EPS declining by 36%, far below the sector's growth rate of 16%. Additionally, forward EBITDA growth is projected to decrease by 3%, compared to a sector increase of 8%, indicating a slowing growth trajectory.
Profitability: CVS boasts high profitability with a Net Income Margin of 1.18%, significantly outperforming the sector median. Its asset turnover ratio of 1.50 is also substantially higher than the sector's 0.45, underscoring efficient asset utilization.
Momentum: CVS exhibits strong stock momentum, with a one-year price performance of 33%, far surpassing the sector median of -12%. This indicates bullish sentiment and strong investor confidence in the company's prospects.
Revisions: Analyst revisions are encouraging, with 26 upward EPS revisions and only 1 downward in the last three months, suggesting an optimistic outlook for future earnings.

In summary, CVS's stock momentum and profitability are commendable, providing a solid foundation. However, growth concerns temper the overall outlook, resulting in a Hold rating, reflective of expectations for the stock to perform in line with its peers.
Positives raised by analysts on Seeking Alpha


CVS Health is seen as deeply undervalued, with intrinsic value calculations suggesting a significant upside potential, indicating the stock could be a good investment for those seeking long-term growth. Read more


The company's strong performance in the retail pharmacy segment, despite industry challenges, highlights its resilience and ability to adapt to changing market conditions. Read more


CVS Health's focus on value-based care and strategic acquisitions positions it well for future growth, as it continues to innovate and expand its healthcare services. Read moreRead more analysis on CVS Concerns raised by analysts on Seeking Alpha


CVS faces significant regulatory and political risks, particularly in its Medicare Advantage and Pharmacy Benefit Management segments, which could impact its profitability and operational stability. Read more


The company's high debt levels, resulting from recent acquisitions, pose a financial risk, potentially limiting its ability to invest in new growth opportunities or weather economic downturns. Read more


CVS's stock price has remained relatively stagnant over the past decade, indicating challenges in convincing investors of its long-term growth potential and strategic direction.   In contrast, Seeking Alpha uses generative AI to create Virtual Analyst Reports exclusively from our own trusted, editor-approved content and financial data. Microsoft CorporationHoldQuant RatingMarket Cap$3.85TEPS Growth (FWD)15.64%P/E (FWD)33.30IndustrySystems SoftwareDividend Yield (FWD)0.70%Dividend FrequencyQuarterlyEx-Dividend Date (Last)11/20/2025Annual Payout (FWD)$3.64Copy URLSharePrintCompany Description
Microsoft Corporation, founded in 1975, is a global leader in developing and supporting a wide range of software, services, devices, and solutions. Headquartered in Redmond, Washington, the company operates through several key segments: Productivity and Business Processes, Intelligent Cloud, and Personal Computing. Microsoft's Productivity and Business Processes segment includes offerings such as Microsoft 365 Commercial, Dynamics 365, LinkedIn, and Copilot, which cater to both commercial and consumer needs. The Intelligent Cloud segment is anchored by Azure, which provides a broad range of cloud services, including AI and data analytics platforms. Additionally, this segment encompasses GitHub, Nuance Healthcare, and various server products. The Personal Computing segment encompasses Windows and Devices, including Surface products, gaming services through Xbox, and search and news advertising via Bing.

Microsoft is actively expanding its cloud and AI capabilities, as evidenced by its substantial investments in data centers and partnerships, such as its collaboration with OpenAI. The company's focus on AI integration is evident in products like Microsoft 365 Copilot and Azure AI services. Microsoft operates over 400 data centers across 70 regions worldwide, making it a leader in cloud infrastructure. The company's strategic investments in AI and cloud technologies underscore its commitment to long-term growth and innovation.
Competitors and Unique Value
Microsoft faces competition from several notable companies that offer similar products and services. Key competitors include:
Amazon Web Services (AWS): A leading provider of cloud computing services, AWS is a primary competitor to Microsoft's Azure platform.
Google Cloud: Part of Alphabet Inc., Google Cloud competes with Azure in cloud services and AI technologies.
Oracle Corporation: Known for its cloud and database services, Oracle competes with Microsoft in the enterprise cloud market.

Microsoft's unique value proposition lies in its extensive integration of AI across its product suite, strong ecosystem of services like Microsoft 365 and Azure, and its robust enterprise solutions. The company's strategic partnerships, such as with OpenAI, enhance its AI capabilities, providing a competitive edge in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.
Seeking Alpha Quant Rating Explanation
MSFT is rated Hold. While the company displays exceptional profitability and solid growth, its valuation appears stretched, and momentum is mixed.
ValuationFGrowthC-ProfitabilityA+MomentumB-RevisionsBSector Metrics Comparative Analysis:Valuation: MSFT's valuation is notably high, with its Price to Sales ratio at 14 compared to the sector median of 4, indicating a premium valuation. This suggests the stock might be overvalued versus its peers.
Growth: MSFT demonstrates robust growth metrics, with Year-over-Year Revenue Growth of 15%, significantly above the sector's 7%. This growth trajectory underscores MSFT's successful expansion in the market.
Profitability: MSFT boasts exceptional profitability, with a Net Income Margin of 36%, substantially higher than the sector's 4%. This indicates efficient operations and strong profit conversion from sales.
Momentum: MSFT's momentum is mixed, with a 1-year price performance of 20%, outperforming the sector's 10%, but the recent 3-month performance lags behind the sector.
Revisions: Analysts have shown optimism, with 41 upward EPS revisions and only 3 downward in the last 90 days, suggesting confidence in MSFT's earnings potential.

Summary  

MSFT exhibits strong profitability and growth, driving positive sentiment among analysts. However, its high valuation and mixed momentum lead to a Hold rating.
Positives raised by analysts on Seeking Alpha


Microsoft is heavily investing in data centers and AI infrastructure, committing $7.3 billion in Wisconsin, which supports long-term cloud and AI growth. Read more


Azure's growth accelerated to 39%, solidifying Microsoft's leadership in AI infrastructure and providing nearly 26% upside over the next 1-2 years. Read more


Microsoft's Azure cloud growth is projected to continue at a strong pace, supported by its leading market position and strategic partnership with OpenAI. Read moreRead more analysis on MSFT Concerns raised by analysts on Seeking Alpha


Microsoft's shares are considered overbought, with expectations too high, as intensified competition in cloud services from Amazon and Google threatens future growth. Read more


Despite strong fundamentals, Microsoft's current share price reflects high expectations for sustained abnormal returns, making its risk-reward profile less compelling. Read more


The AI market, crucial for Microsoft's growth, is seen as potentially entering a bubble, with no clear new catalysts on the horizon to justify the high valuation.   In contrast, Seeking Alpha uses generative AI to create Virtual Analyst Reports exclusively from our own trusted, editor-approved content and financial data. We use unique sources exclusive to Seeking Alpha. These sources have excellent stock picking track records, and are produced by investors, for investors.
